info.title: arksys Microservice API Specification
info.description: API guide for safe-guarding and preservation of archival data

OAuth2: Please contact Arkivum Support for OAuth2 parameters for your tenant

tags.name: Export
tags.description: Request and monitor the progress of exports

tags.name: Ingest
tags.description: Create and monitor the progress of ingests

get.description: Get a specific retention schedule by its ID

put.description: Edit the default flag for a retention schedule

get.description: Get a specific retention schedule by its ID

put.description: Edit the default flag for a retention schedule

get.description: Get a list of relations given an externalId

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: The externalId to get relations for

parameters.name: relationType
parameters.description: The type of relation between the two entities

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: The name of the source entity in the relation

parameters.name: destinationId
parameters.description: The name of the destination entity in the relation

parameters.name: jobRequestId
parameters.description: The id of the JobRequest in which this relation is created

parameters.name: id1
parameters.description: The name of the first entity in the relation

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: The name of the second entity in the relation

parameters.name: relationType
parameters.description: The type of relation to be removed. If no type is supplied all relations between the two entities will be removed

get.description: Get a RelationKind by its kind

parameters.name: kindValue
parameters.description: The relation kindValue

parameters.name: kindValue
parameters.description: The Relation Kind value

400.description: Request was malformed in some way

parameters.name: kindValue
parameters.description: The Relation Kind value

400.description: Request was malformed in some way

parameters.name: queryName
parameters.description: The name of the saved query

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the query to update

parameters.name: datapool
parameters.description: List of datapool names

parameters.name: fileClass
parameters.description: Set to either REGULAR or PRESERVATION

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Represents the query that is to be saved

parameters.name: queryName
parameters.description: The name of the saved query

get.description: Lists the data pools that the logged in user has access to

400.description: Cannot update datapool as it is not empty; Cannot remove AtoM or ISADG namespaces from an AtoM enabled datapool; Cannot remove Dublin Core namespace from an AtoM disabled datapool; Identifier namespace is required for preservation enabled datapools; Technical namespace is required for datapools

404.description: Datapool doesn't exist: {datapool name}

post.description: Creates datapool

put.description: Get the cleanup config for either the import or export bucket.

parameters.name: isDedicatedArchivematica
parameters.description: The new value for the dedicated archivematica flag

get.description: Get the cleanup config for either the import or export bucket.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Get the cleanup config for either the import or export bucket.

parameters.name: locationId
parameters.description: Get the cleanup config for this location.

put.description: Configure whether files are automatically cleaned up from either the import or export bucket.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of bucket to clean up - IMPORT or EXPORT

parameters.name: locationId
parameters.description: Get the cleanup config for this location.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value for the import or export cleanup config

put.description: Updates a retention schedule associated with an aggregation.A successful response returns the modified aggregation in the response body.The endpoint contains the aggregation identifier that's to be updated and also the retention identifier that's to be updated. That retention identifier is replaced with the retention identifier that is specified in the request

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. This is an alphanumeric identifier (no spaces or special characters).

parameters.name: retentionId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the retention schedule that you want to replace.The retention schedule must already exist.

schema.description: Unique identifier of the retention schedule to be associated with the aggregation

400.description: Cannot update Retention. Retention <retention id> does not exist on Aggregation <aggregation id>; Cannot add Retention to Aggregation. Retention type is different: <retention type>; Cannot add Retention to Aggregation. Retention category is different: <retention category>;

500.description: Failed to update audit table on deleting retention <retention id> from aggregation <aggregation id>

404.description: Cannot update retention of Aggregation. No entity with id <aggregation id> exists; Cannot update retention of Aggregation. No retention with id <retention id> exists

delete.description: Deletes a retention schedule associated with an aggregation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. This is an alphanumeric identifier (no spaces or special characters).

parameters.name: retentionId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the retention schedule to be associated with the aggregation.The retention schedule must already exist.

parameters.name: retention
parameters.description: Flag to specify whether default retention should be reapplied if no retentions are left on the entity

put.description: Updates a retention schedule associated with an aggregation.A successful response returns the modified aggregation in the response body.The endpoint contains the aggregation identifier that's to be updated and also the retention identifier that's to be updated. That retention identifier is replaced with the retention identifier that is specified in the request

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. This is an alphanumeric identifier (no spaces or special characters).

parameters.name: retentionId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the retention schedule that you want to replace.The retention schedule must already exist.

schema.description: Unique identifier of the retention schedule to be associated with the aggregation

400.description: Cannot update Retention. Retention <retention id> does not exist on Aggregation <aggregation id>; Cannot add Retention to Aggregation. Retention type is different: <retention type>; Cannot add Retention to Aggregation. Retention category is different: <retention category>;

500.description: Failed to update audit table on deleting retention <retention id> from aggregation <aggregation id>

404.description: Cannot update retention of Aggregation. No entity with id <aggregation id> exists; Cannot update retention of Aggregation. No retention with id <retention id> exists

delete.description: Deletes a retention schedule associated with an aggregation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. This is an alphanumeric identifier (no spaces or special characters).

parameters.name: retentionId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the retention schedule to be associated with the aggregation.The retention schedule must already exist.

parameters.name: retention
parameters.description: Flag to specify whether default retention should be reapplied if no retentions are left on the entity

post.description: If given a parentId it will return a paginated list of aggregations (of collection or object type) that are the children of the given aggregation. Otherwise it will return a list of all aggregations (of collection or object type) that do not have a parent.

schema.description: Number of items in a page
External aggregation ID to query for its children. If empty then it will return all aggregations without a parent.
Fields to sort by, prefixed with '-' for descending

400.description: Incorrect search parameter - 'errorMessage' in response should give more details

404.description: Given entity ID could not be found - 'errorMessage' in response should give more details

200.description: Successful search with tree view results

500.description: Unexpected error during search - 'errorMessage' in response should give more details

post.description: Gets a page of retention schedules
Gets a page of retention schedules
Create a new retention schedule

parameters.name: years
parameters.description: The number of years that an entity should be retained for

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: The number of days that an entity should be retained for

parameters.name: hours
parameters.description: The number of hours that an entity should be retained for

parameters.name: minutes
parameters.description: The number of minutes that an entity should be retained for

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: A short description for what the retention rule will be used for

parameters.name: isDefault
parameters.description: Whether this is the default retention or not

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to be carried out when the retention ends

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type for which the retention can be applied

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the retention

get.description: Get all Metadata Namespace Configurations

post.description: Create a Metadata Namespace configuration

500.description: Failed to add mapping {prefix} for aggregationType {type} tenant {tenant}

400.description: MetadataNamespaceConfig undefined; MetadataNamespaceConfig uri is undefined; MetadataNamespaceConfig prefix is undefined; MetadataNamespaceConfig label is undefined; MetadataNamespaceConfig fields is undefined; Null is not a valid Aggregation Type!; MetadataNamespaceConfig is mandatory and no mandatory field present in the config; MetadataNamespaceConfig fields are repeated; MetadataNamespaceConfig prefix is already present in the system; MetadataNamespaceConfig prefix has '.' in the name

404.description: Namespace doesn't exist

post.description: Generates the integrity report
Generates the integrity report
Ingest data from an ingest location

parameters.name: ingestPath
parameters.description: The path within the ingest location to files (or file) to be ingested, should be URL encoded

parameters.name: metadataPath
parameters.description: The path within the ingest location to a metadata file, should be URL encoded

parameters.name: datapool
parameters.description: The name of the datapool into which files are to be ingested, should be URL encoded. Defaults to the default datapool

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: The folder path used to prefix files paths being ingested, should be URL encoded

parameters.name: jobTag
parameters.description: A tag to be used to link related ingests, should be URL encoded

parameters.name: unpack
parameters.description: Whether archives detected in the ingest location are unpacked or ingested without unpacking. Defaults to false

parameters.name: isArchive
parameters.description: Whether archives detected in the ingest location are unpacked before the ingest begins or ingested without unpacking. Defaults to false

parameters.name: splitterChildren
parameters.description: The maximum number of files under a collection or object which can be preserved in one job. Above the threshold files are allocated to separate preservation jobs. Defaults to 10,000

parameters.name: locationId
parameters.description: The identifier of an ingest location. Defaults to the first ingest location.

404.description: The requested resource cannot be found. The errorMessage will give more detail

400.description: The request is in error in some way e.g. bad parameter. The errorMessage will give more detail

post.description: Export a single entity and its children. The exported contents and associated metadata are placed in the requested location.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Entity id to be exported

parameters.name: exportPath
parameters.description: The path within the export location. Defaults to export/{exportId}

parameters.name: locationId
parameters.description: The identifier of an export location. Defaults to the first export location.

parameters.name: exportMetadataType
parameters.description: Whether to export content, metadata or both.

parameters.name: includeURI
parameters.description: Whether to include the uri of the files in the exported ark-manifest.json. Defaults to false

parameters.name: exportFormat
parameters.description: The format that the data should be exported as. Ignored if exportMetadataType is set to 'CONTENT'

parameters.name: includeTechnicalMetadata
parameters.description: Whether to include technical metadata in ark-manifest.json. Defaults to false.

get.description:
Searches for documents in Elasticsearch. This is a simpler option for writing quick queries but it limits what one can search for. The parameter of the request is the search query string.
Note: All '/' in queries must be preceded by a '\', i.e. a search for 'foo/bar' must be written as 'foo\/bar'

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Where type is either F, O or C for File, Object or Collection respectively

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Represents the query that is sent to search

400.description: Incorrect search parameter or too many search results - 'errorMessage' in response should give more details

post.description:
Searches for metadata documents in Elasticsearch.
Full documentation on writing these queries can be found in the Elasticsearch 7.x documentation: 
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.x/query-dsl.html

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Where type is either F, O or C for File, Object or Collection respectively

schema.description: Number of items in a page

400.description: Incorrect search parameter or too many search results - 'errorMessage' in response should give more details

post.description: Creates a new aggregation of type C or O, which represents a collection or object. This new entity is created as a child (or a member in PCDM terminology) of the specified parent.

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: The aggregation UUID of the parent ID.The specified parentId must refer to an existing aggregation

403.description: Failed to identify default retention for type '%s' and category '%s'.

400.description: Cannot create aggregation with ID '<aggr_id>' as it is already in use.Cannot create aggregation <aggregation id> with category >aggregation category>, as that category does not exist.Cannot create aggregation with null type.Mandatory parameter missing: aggregationType.Cannot create aggregation with id: '<aggr_d>'.The proposed membership relationship would create a cycle in the database. For example, if A contains B contains C and an attempt is made to add A as a child of C, this would be prevented.The proposed membership relationship is invalid with the respect to the PCDM spec (C>C, C>O, O>O).

201.description: Successfully created child of the entity

404.description: Cannot create aggregation with retention ID '<retention_id>' as it is not recognised.Cannot add Retention to Aggregation. Retention type is different: <retention type>Cannot add Retention to Aggregation. Retention category is different: <retention category>The provided parentId does not refer to an existing parent entity.

post.description: Creates a new aggregation of type C or O, which represents a collection or object. This new entity is created as a child (or a member in PCDM terminology) of the specified parent.

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: The aggregation UUID of the parent ID.The specified parentId must refer to an existing aggregation

403.description: Failed to identify default retention for type '%s' and category '%s'.

400.description: Cannot create aggregation with ID '<aggr_id>' as it is already in use.Cannot create aggregation <aggregation id> with category >aggregation category>, as that category does not exist.Cannot create aggregation with null type.Mandatory parameter missing: aggregationType.Cannot create aggregation with id: '<aggr_d>'.The proposed membership relationship would create a cycle in the database. For example, if A contains B contains C and an attempt is made to add A as a child of C, this would be prevented.The proposed membership relationship is invalid with the respect to the PCDM spec (C>C, C>O, O>O).

201.description: Successfully created child of the entity

404.description: Cannot create aggregation with retention ID '<retention_id>' as it is not recognised.Cannot add Retention to Aggregation. Retention type is different: <retention type>Cannot add Retention to Aggregation. Retention category is different: <retention category>The provided parentId does not refer to an existing parent entity.

post.description: Adds an existing retention schedule to an aggregation (object or collection).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. This is an alphanumeric identifier (no spaces or special characters).

schema.description: Unique identifier of the retention schedule to be added to the aggregation.The retention schedule must already exist.

post.description: Adds an existing retention schedule to an aggregation (object or collection).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. This is an alphanumeric identifier (no spaces or special characters).

schema.description: Unique identifier of the retention schedule to be added to the aggregation.The retention schedule must already exist.

post.description: A PCDM collection can be preserved. The collection is sent to preservation for preparation of an AIP. The AIP is created and returned to the Arkivum system for long-term preservation and storage. The AIP generated contains the files, file metadata (Dublin Core and custom), checksums and the file formats to be used.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The collection_id (PCDM collection identifier).

parameters.name: datapool
parameters.description: The unique name of the data pool where the preserved package is ingested.

parameters.name: jobTag
parameters.description: A tag to give the preservation job

post.description: A PCDM collection can be preserved. The collection is sent to preservation for preparation of an AIP. The AIP is created and returned to the Arkivum system for long-term preservation and storage. The AIP generated contains the files, file metadata (Dublin Core and custom), checksums and the file formats to be used.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The collection_id (PCDM collection identifier).

parameters.name: datapool
parameters.description: The unique name of the data pool where the preserved package is ingested.

parameters.name: jobTag
parameters.description: A tag to give the preservation job

post.description: Creates a child link between the parent and child aggregations. The parent and child UUIDs must be specified, must exist and cannot be the same.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. The aggregation must have been created beforehand.The endpoint ID cannot be a file type and must not be the same as any of the link IDs.

parameters.name: abortOnError
parameters.description: Whether to proceed if you encounter an error processing one item. The default value is false (process the rest of the items even if one fails). Set to true if you need to abort the operation if any errors are encountered.

schema.description: List of unique identifiers to be linked to the aggregation. These aggregations must be created beforehand.These aggregations must be created beforehandThe retention schedule must already exist.

post.description: Creates a child link between the parent and child aggregations. The parent and child UUIDs must be specified, must exist and cannot be the same.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. The aggregation must have been created beforehand.The endpoint ID cannot be a file type and must not be the same as any of the link IDs.

parameters.name: abortOnError
parameters.description: Whether to proceed if you encounter an error processing one item. The default value is false (process the rest of the items even if one fails). Set to true if you need to abort the operation if any errors are encountered.

schema.description: List of unique identifiers to be linked to the aggregation. These aggregations must be created beforehand.These aggregations must be created beforehandThe retention schedule must already exist.

post.description: Creates a new hold on an object or collection.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. This is an alphanumeric identifier (no spaces or special characters).

500.description: Failed to create hold on Aggregation <aggregation id>.   Failed to update audit table on adding hold <hold_id> to aggregation <aggregation id>.

404.description: Cannot add Hold to Aggregation. No entity with id <aggregation id> exists.

400.description: Please provide a reason for adding the hold.

post.description: Creates a new hold on an object or collection.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Aggregation UUID. This is an alphanumeric identifier (no spaces or special characters).

500.description: Failed to create hold on Aggregation <aggregation id>.   Failed to update audit table on adding hold <hold_id> to aggregation <aggregation id>.

404.description: Cannot add Hold to Aggregation. No entity with id <aggregation id> exists.

400.description: Please provide a reason for adding the hold.

post.description: Detaches all existing aggregations from the parent collection.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Parent aggregation UUID. Parent UUID must exist

EffectiveRetention.description: The set of retentions for this entity

parents.description: List of externalIds of the parents of this entity

items.description: List of externalIds of the parents of this entity

effectiveRetentions.description: The set of retentions for this entity

holds.description: The set of holds for this entity

hasChildren.description: Whether this entity has any children that can be further expanded within the tree

hasRelations.description: Whether this entity has any relations

reason.description: A human readable justification for the hold being placed or deleted

Hold.description: The set of holds for this entity

key.description: The field name where the filter has to be applied

value2.description: Value to compare to. To be passed when the operator is inrange (between)

fieldName.description: The field name to sort by

orderBy.description: Whether to sort in ascending or descending order.

datapoolName.description: Name of the datapool where the content belongs to

errorMessage.description: Error message if a processing step fails

tryAgainAfter.description: Time at which to try the processing step again

millisTaken.description: How long the step took to complete in milliseconds

stepVersion.description: The version of the step - ensure exactly once semantics on step processing

modifiedTime.description: Date time in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

datapool.description: URL encoded unique name of the data pool where the files are to be ingested. All files are ingested into the root of the specified Datapool. If additional levels are desired this can be achieved via the structure of the folders within the ingest location.

ingestPath.description: URL encoded path within the ingest location to the root folder containing the files.

metadataPath.description: URL encoded path within the ingest location to a metadata file. The processing of the metadataPath depend on its suffix, if the ending is xml it is assumed to be in xml format. If an XSLT transform is registered for the tenant is is applied first and then processed. If the suffix is csv it is processed as a CSV metadata file

additionalProperties.description: Error messages of a failed ingest (status == FAILED)

errorMessages.description: Error messages of a failed ingest (status == FAILED)

collectionId.description: The identifier of the collection into which the files and metadata are ingested

folderPath.description: A custom folder path to be used for all files in an ingest

jobTag.description: A custom tag used to link related ingests

unpack.description: Flag to indicate whether you want your archives to be unpacked during the ingest

locationId.description: The identifier of the location from which the files are ingested
The location the export with be saved in

exportRequestedTime.description: The time the export occurred in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

lastModifiedTime.description: The last updated time of the export record in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

exportError.description: The error message of a failed export

ids.description: A list of external ids to be exported. This should only be populated for the export list API.

items.description: A list of external ids to be exported. This should only be populated for the export list API.

displayName.description: Display Name, does not have to be unique.

startDate.description: Date of creation (ISO format, UTC). Generated based on the current time, unless specified as a parameter.

retentionId.description: Retention ID that maps to a retention schedule. If not added, defaults to a standard schedule. The system is deployed with a default retention up to 2218-12-31.

category.description: Object/collection type, for example, PDF, email, and voice. Not in use yet.

children.description: List of the aggregations to link to the new parent

items.description: List of the aggregations to link to the new parent

reason.description: Reason to create or remove a hold

reportStatus.description: The status of the generation of the deletion report

reportTime.description: The Date/time stamp of when the deletion report was requested, in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

reportLastModified.description: The last updated time of the deletion report in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

deletionTime.description: The Date/time stamp of when the deletion was requested, in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

deletionLastModified.description: The last updated time of the deletion request in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

deletionError.description: The error message of a failed deletion

id.description: An identifier for an entity present in the deletion scope
An identifier for an entity present in the deletion scope

errors.description: A list of errors preventing the entity from be deleted

items.description: A list of errors preventing the entity from be deleted

id.description: An identifier for an entity present in the deletion scope

duplicateFiles.description: A list of duplicate files in the system which are not in the deletioin scope

items.description: A list of duplicate files in the system which are not in the deletioin scope

locationType.description: The location type of the location

provider.description: The cloud provider of the bucket

additionalProperties.description: Error messages of a failed job (status == FAILED)

errorMessages.description: Error messages of a failed job (status == FAILED)

jobTag.description: A custom tag used to link related jobs

additionalProperties.description: Number of entities by status by step
Number of entities by status by step

entitiesByStatusByStep.description: Number of entities by status by step

additionalProperties.description: Number of entities by aggregation type

entitiesByAggregationType.description: Number of entities by aggregation type

lastModifiedTime.description: The last updated time for the ingest

directory.description: Flag to denote whether this represents a directory

lastModified.description: Timestamp when the file metadata is last modified in the system in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

createdDate.description: Timestamp when the file is ingested into the system in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

accessTime.description: Timestamp when the file is last accessed from the system in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

local.description: Redundant field. This is applicable only for datapoolsets with tape location and Denotes whether a file is in the archive locations or not
